Overnight parking area on the edge of the village.
Infrastructure for electricity, water, showers and dumping are in place but not currently available.
The village has a tourist information centre, museum, castle ruins and air raid shelter.
There is a fresh fruit and vegetable store and a small supermarket. There are also cafes and bars.
The village council are hoping to the facilities for stopping over available as soon as possible.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - A-420

name: Complejo La Mirada
title: (23748) Complejo La Mirada

title: (23748) Andújar - A-6177
description: Recreational area of "El Jabalí". Area a few kilometers from the sanctuary of the Virgen de la Cabeza. In the middle of Sierra Morena. Shaded areas, no water, with bins.

title: (23770) Marmolejo - A-420
description: Parking bay along side of road, gravel track that was fine for our van. overlooks the reservoir below and nice and quiet at night. amazing for star gazing! no services here and limited phone service

title: (23780) Lopera - 48 Avenida Andalucia
description: Parking in front of an Institute the area is quite quiet and next door you can eat the best churros in the whole province, they also make toast and snacks ...

title: (23780) Lopera - 17 Calle Cuesta
description: Lopera is a small town in the province of Jaen and between the Castle and El Paseo you can park. It is a very quiet and beautiful town. Nearby you have bars where tapas and supermarkets where to buy. There are guided tours of its beautiful Castle and La Tercia. (((Wifi))). POINT WICO FREE WIFI ...

title: (23210) Zocueca -
description: Service station, it has restrooms for public use in good condition. They let us fill the water tank and although they don't have a place to discharge water, they told us that we could discharge gray water on a piece of land that they have attached to the station.

title: (23657) Escañuela - 52 Avenida de Andalucía
description: ESCANUELA Small village surrounded by olive trees. No problem staying overnight or more. Small parking lot at the exit of the village. no service.

title: (23210) Zocueca - A-4
description:
Rest area on the way, behind a gas station and an abandoned restaurant. Close to the road but not too noisy and next to a river. Recommended for one night and follow the route.
The gas station is very cheap, it has gas, you can take free water and rubbish.
There are no trucks, so it is quieter than other areas near the highway.

name: Mirador del embalse del Jándula
title: (23748) Mirador del embalse del Jándula
description:
A stunning space for up to 3 vans.  A peaceful and tranquil stay immersed in nature with Eagles and Vultures flying overhead and the opportunity to spot Lnyx and Deer. 
It is at the end of a 10KM rough track but the vista is worth every bump. 
The reason why we camp offgrid.

No water or bins so you bring what you need and take home what you used. 

Popular are for fishing and wildlife spotting.

title: (23740) Andújar - JF-5004
description: Parking at the end of La Lancha road (gravel and potholed but drivable) famous among lynx watchers. The parking is right by the dam so expect some gentle noise at night. Good shade in the afternoon from big eucalyptus trees. The parking is quite popular during the weekends but nobody stayed overnight in March. We have a pleasant week there without problems. A nice short walk starts right from the parking - good for birdwatching and watching ibex up the rocks. For birdwatching, you can also cross the dam and walk along the road. There are turtles in the lake. If you are in this area for lynx watching this is a perfect place for a night. Just 15 minutes drive back in the direction of farms and the main road there are three lookouts to observe lynxes (if you are lucky). We saw only one during our week-long stay. Other wildlife such as red deers, fallow deers, mouflons are present. Spanish imperial eagle is possible too from the lookouts. Definitely, a perfect place for a prolonged stay, especially if you are a nature lover. The parking is spacey enough even for several big motorhomes. There are no services, no source of water and no rubbish bin. You have to be fully self-sufficient to enjoy this place.

title: (14640) Villa del Río - 16 Carretera Madrid Cadiz
title_short: (14640) Villa del Río - 16 Carretera Madrid Cadiz
description: Small village super nice and very quiet, parking along a nice little park in the shade

title: (14640) Villa del Río -
description: This is a car park that can take around 6 motorhomes without disturbing the locals. Slight distant road noise from the highway. Quiet town with some shops. The car park is on a good level paved surface and is well lit. Behind the car park there is a river. the small building that can be seen at the entrance is a churrería, wonderful for breakfast in the sun

title: (23790) Porcuna - sn Paseo de Jesús

title: (23710) Bailén - Unnamed Road

title: (23710) Bailén - 31 Calle Paquita Torres
description: Quiet place to park and sleep. near the center

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina -
description: Great, largely shady place on the edge of the forest right on the reservoir. Depending on the water level, it is a few meters down to the shore, when the water level is full you are almost right on the water. In the morning completely shaded by the trees, during the day there are also sunny spots to sit or lie down. Fantastic nature that is rarely found in the area. The access is recommended via the upper of the two paths and is very bumpy with larger rocks, but also possible without a 4x4.

title: (14446) Venta del Charco - 4 Calle Españares
description: Parking in the center of the village near restaurants. Ideal for walks on bike or motorbike

title: (14446) Venta del Charco - 16 Calle San Miguel
title_short: (14446) Venta del Charco - 16 Calle San Miguel

title: (23711) Baños de la Encina - Unnamed Road
title_short: (23711) Baños de la Encina - Unnamed Road

title: (23600) Martos - 2F Calle Niño Jesús
description:
Large parking area with a long promenade with good views of the city and close to the old town so you can park and visit it on foot. There is also a recently built playground for the little ones. In winter it is usually quiet but in summer it is more crowded in the afternoons since people go up there to eat and hang out, taking advantage of the fact that due to its location there is usually a breeze and it is cooler than in the city. There are several food delivery establishments that have no problem delivering there, you just have to tell them that you are in the Paseo del Calvario parking lot. There is no sign restricting the use of motorhomes.

TO ACCESS YOU HAVE TO ENTER FROM THE HEALTH CENTER (C/Molino Medel) The other itineraries are too narrow

title: (23009) Jaén - 9 Calle Principado de Asturias

title: (23006) Jaén - 9 Calle San Francisco Javier

title: (14630) Pedro Abad - N-IV
description: Handy stopover but very noisy due to the main road nearby.  Chemical disposal point, fresh and waste water points and outdoor urinals. The chemical waste point is rather dirty, but what can you expect from a free stopover I suppose?!  The locals use the area as a walking loop, with or without dogs. The Spanish don't seem to pick up after their dogs so be careful, however, a lady with a long handled brush and dustpan went around the following morning and swept it all up, kudos to her!

title: (23004) Jaén - 2 Explanada Cañoquebrado

title: (23600) Martos - 15 Calle Doctor Espejo Maldona

very nice city with atmosphere.

description: Rest area if you are passing through, quiet place,

title: (14430) Adamuz - 7 Calle de los Granadillos
description: Large car park behind a school, close to all amenities. There is cafe, gas station, commerce and right next to the city center. We arrived on a Saturday night getting lost in the area. Very calm.

title: (23614) Las Casillas -
description: Parking on the site of the former Estación Vado Jaén train station, on the route of the via verde del aceite cycle path. Large picnic area. Some road noise. No services.

title: (23200) La Carolina - JA-6100
description: Thanks to 2 yellow posts (left side after the bridge) you can take a rough 100m road with the motorhome (quite unsuitable for large mobile homes) to the river. At the bottom there is a large flat lot (space for at least 3 campers). Cooling down in midsummer is wonderful. We only had one break, but you can certainly spend the night there without a problem.

title: (23211) Carboneros - 56 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Large parking behind service station (gasoil cheap) close to the E5 which leads to Madrid ... Take the exit number 275 in the direction Beilen Madrid night possible without problems (seen with the head of the station) open 24 hours a day illuminated at night under development for future services

title: (14430) Adamuz - 8 A-421
description: Picnic area a bit abandoned but usable.

title: (23160) Los Villares - JA-3300
description: Cozy place in the olive grove on a quiet side street. Sun from morning to evening.

title: (23214) El Centenillo - 4 Calle Pocicos
description: Parking in soccer field

title: (23214) Baños de la Encina - JM-5005
description: Beautiful place to spend a couple of days, in the middle of the ruins of the mining town, next to the master well of the place, 660 meters deep. We have done the MTB route from here going to La Carolina. Also hiking, visiting the different vestiges of this mining town. From this site you can see quite a few deer. Very quiet nights.

title: (23214) Baños de la Encina - JM-5005
description: Picnic area, drinking water, 4G 4 bars, quiet, first night impeccable, near El Centenillio, (old lead pencil and silver), site to see. further down the al aire meme, I have just seen a tap of drinking water next to barbecues and picnic tables, full of birds, especially the "Pie Bleue". Nice people. a nice place for relaxation, the landscapes leading to this place are very beautiful, beware the road is good but narrow.

title: (23196) Puente de la Sierra -
description: High pressure drinking water fountain

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba -
description: Perfect esplanade to park and enjoy a beautiful sunset. Very quiet night despite the proximity of the road

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba -
description: On the edge of a very rarely used gravel road. Beautiful 360° view. The driveway is a bit steep but doable. The small street that turns off is a dead end, further back there are more places.

title: (14420) Villafranca de Córdoba -
description: Fantastic place at the observatory for migratory birds. Absolutely quiet and lonely, the view is gigantic. Access via gravel road, a bit bumpy, but no problem without all-wheel drive. No infrastructure, 4 G.

title: (23160) Los Villares - 6 Calle Egido
description: Parking area inclined, few seats, not very comfortable

title: (23160) Los Villares - 5 Calle García Lorca
description: Asphalted parking in a square on the top of the city, nearby there is an olive bar with terrace and good fish

title: (23214) - 1 Poblado el Guindo
description: Esplanade in the mining town of Cherry (Caroline, Sierra Morena). Breathtaking views. As Starlight Destination included by UNESCO. A bit narrow for large motorhomes

title: (13594) Solanilla del Tamaral -
description: Small hiking trail parking lot, next to a road with very little traffic. Nice views and possibility to spend the night.

title: () La Guardia de Jaén - Unnamed Road
title_short: () La Guardia de Jaén - Unnamed Road
description: Recreational area with a great experience. Nice and quiet at sunset. Paved access but very steep road. Still accessible to Ac.

title: (14859) Albendín - 26 Calle Noria
description: A new area with gray water and black water emptying point and clean water filling point very very cozy quiet town

title: (23614) Las Casillas - JA-3307
description: Parking next to picnic areas with views of the Vibora reservoir, a very quiet place.

title: (23614) Martos -
description: In the morning you can wake up with the sound of sheep bells... Hundreds of them. Easy access to water. There plenty places to park and sleep a few meters from water. Calm and pretty place to spend a night. There is a nice bar at the main square of the Village called Bar Mendoza where they serve amazing tapas.

title: (23200) La Carolina - 29 Calle Nuestro Padre Jesús
title_short: (23200) La Carolina - 29 Calle Nuestro Padre Jesús
description: Possibility to park for the night for free. calm night.

title: (23170) La Guardia de Jaén - Paseo de Andalucía
title_short: (23170) La Guardia de Jaén - Paseo de Andalucía
description: Free parking, level, with free services and nice views.

title: (23614) Martos -
description: Recreational area of the viper reservoir. Dirt lane.

title: (13593) Solana del Pino - Calle Primero de Mayo
title_short: (13593) Solana del Pino - Calle Primero de Mayo
description: Nice parking and free night for 8 motorhomes, in a natural point of view with a fantastic view of the Sierra Madrona, located near the municipal swimming pool. A wonder to enjoy the nature of the Alcudia Valley and the Sierra Madrona Natural Park

title: (23100) Mancha Real - A-320
description: Free parking. With picnic areas and painted on the ground for children's games

title: (13593) Solana del Pino -
description: Helipad level esplanade and behind the cemetery. Next to the town. Good starting point for excursions and as a base to get to know the Valle de Alcudia and Sierra Madrona natural park. You go down a paved road in good condition. At the beginning of this street there are garbage cans and a fountain. In the village bakery, butcher, honey, bars. The town wants motorhome tourism, please respect the parking area.

title: (14850) Córdoba - 79 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Picnic area with large gravel parking lot. Apparently occasionally used by the community, some locked facilities. Absolute silence, never a car. Extensive grounds with many picnic tables, also in the grove.

title: (13594) Solanilla del Tamaral -
description: Nice location along a quiet road and one of the few suitable locations in this area to stay in your vehicle. along running water against a slope where the red deer and mountain goats come to eat in the evening and morning. no facilities and no internet coverage.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente -
description: Parking Shelter of Peña Escrita. Ideal to start routes and visit the cave paintings. Access is by a narrow and continuous road along an unpaved road. Note on the routes: During the high fire danger season (June 1 - September 30), access will be subject to the sectoral legislation in this regard.

title: (14859) Albendín - Unnamed Road
description: On the dam about 8 parking spaces from the Naitic Club directly on the lake. We stayed here with 2 campers. Bar with great food available. It runs the 9km off the main road to get here. Class

title: () Mancha Real - JA-3203
description: Nice spot with lots of walks in the surrounding area, could get a bit hectic in summer or the paragliding season.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - Unnamed Road
description: Picnic picnic with water fountain next to the Fuencaliente soccer field. Very quiet place

title: (23196) Otiñar -
description: Parking on the side of the minor road in the gorge under Otinar Castle. Lovely peaceful spot with just sound of sheep and honey bees. Ruins of Otinar castle accessed by track just to the north.

title: (23660) Alcaudete - 39D Calle Paco el Arriero
description: Basic service area, a little difficult to access but accessible to all vehicles except large trucks, key access to water to take with the municipal police. Nice view and close to the castle for the visit.

title: (23660) Alcaudete - 28 Calle Peñuelas
description: Ample parking, with quite a slope although the upper part is quite level, quiet night.

name: Área de autocaravanas automática
title: (13130) Área de autocaravanas automática
description: Automatic motorhome area. It is similar to those that exist in the community of Castilla la Mancha. You have access by credit card. The water change is paid separately and the bathrooms and toilets are also paid separately. The 14 seats are somewhat uneven but with fixing chocks. There are different routes that can be consulted on the website of the Fuencaliente town hall.

title: (13130) Fuencaliente - N-420
description: Recreation area with drinking water, a stream, tables and many trees.

title: (14850) Baena - 88T Avenida Padre Villoslada
description: Parking with beautiful views of the town in a quiet neighborhood. Nearby there is a children's play area and a soccer field. Right next door there is a Carrefour with a gas station and a water outlet, as well as a car wash. It is right at the entrance of the town, close to the road.

title: (14850) Baena - 1 Calle Guardia Civil
description: Esplanade stadium occupied by carnival during the holy week 2017 (April 12) we found this large parking near the high school, flat, cemented and very quiet (school holidays?) With bins and fallow land ideal for taking out the dog.

title: (14850) Baena - 1 Calle Iznajar
description: Paved parking for cars. No services. At 10 minutes from the center.

title: (14880) Luque - CO-6204
description:
Parking actually for the excursion point
"Laguna del Salobral.
However, the lagoon has completely dried up. so it is rarely visited.
A very very quiet place.
In the midst of olive plantations.
No problems.

The place is right on the bike path
"Via Verde del Aceite"
This bike path is an open railway line. (olive oil train). In this area it runs through a very beautiful part of Andalusia. Over bridges and small gorges, almost flat.
Ideal for small bike tours.

title: (23685) Sabariego -
description: Beautiful rest area with bbq's, picnic area, and fresh water source right next to a river. Almost no traffic and a quiet night.
